Package edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors

Class Actor

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameEntity
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.actors.Actor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Printable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Blacksmith, Bug, EnemyActor, Player, Player, Player, Trader
public abstract class Actor
extends GameEntity
implements Printable
The Actor class represents a GameEntity that can perform an Action. It has a hit points attribute, which represents its health. When this value reaches zero, the Actor is unconscious. Additionally, an Actor has a collection of Items it is carrying in its inventory.

    • Actor

      public Actor​(java.lang.String name, char displayChar, int hitPoints)
      The constructor of the Actor class.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the Actor
      displayChar - the character that will represent the Actor in the display
      hitPoints - the Actor's starting hit points

  • Method Details

    • hasAttribute

      public boolean hasAttribute​(java.lang.Enum<?> name)
      A method for checking whether this actor has a specific attribute
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the attribute, such as BaseActorAttributes.HEALTH
      Returns:
      true if the actor has the queried attribute, false otherwise

    • addAttribute

      public void addAttribute​(java.lang.Enum<?> name, ActorAttribute<java.lang.Integer> attribute)
      A method for adding an attribute to the actor.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the attribute to be added, which must be a value of an enumeration, such as BaseActorAttributes.STAMINA.
      attribute - an object that implements the ActorAttribute interface.

    • modifyAttribute

      public void modifyAttribute​(java.lang.Enum<?> name, ActorAttributeOperations operation, int value) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      A method for modifying the value of an attribute. An alternative implementation to this method is to create several smaller methods, such as increaseAttribute(), decreaseAttribute(), and updateAttribute(). However, this results in the Actor class being bloated with boilerplate methods. Another alternative is to simply return the attribute object and let the client modify it directly. However, this results in privacy leak, i.e. the client directly knows the underlying implementation of the attributes, which could result in unwanted dependencies. Therefore, this method is chosen as a compromise. It could be improved with the use of higher-order functions, but since it is not relevant to object-oriented programming, it is not implemented here.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the attribute to be modified, which must be a value of an enumeration, such as BaseActorAttributes.STAMINA.
      operation - the operation to be performed on the attribute, such as INCREASE, DECREASE, or UPDATE.
      value - the value to be used in the operation.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the operation is invalid.

    • modifyAttributeMaximum

      public void modifyAttributeMaximum​(java.lang.Enum<?> name, ActorAttributeOperations operation, int value) throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
      A method for modifying the maximum value of an attribute. See the rationale for modifyAttribute(Enum, ActorAttributeOperations, int) for why this method is implemented this way.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the attribute to be modified, which must be a value of an enumeration, such as BaseActorAttributes.STAMINA.
      operation - the operation to be performed on the attribute, such as INCREASE, DECREASE, or UPDATE.
      value - the value to be used in the operation.
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the operation is invalid.

    • getAttribute

      public int getAttribute​(java.lang.Enum<?> name)
      A method for getting the value of an attribute.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the attribute to be retrieved, which must be a value of an enumeration, such as BaseActorAttributes.STAMINA.
      Returns:
      the value of the attribute.

    • getAttributeMaximum

      public int getAttributeMaximum​(java.lang.Enum<?> name)
      A method for getting the maximum value of an attribute, such as the maximum hit points of the current actor.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the attribute to be retrieved, which must be a value of an enumeration, such as BaseActorAttributes.STAMINA.
      Returns:
      the maximum value of the attribute.

    • addBalance

      public void addBalance​(int amount)
      A method for increasing the balance of the Actor's wallet. Although this can be handled by the Wallet class itself, the prevention of privacy leak is prioritised.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to be added to the balance

    • deductBalance

      public void deductBalance​(int amount)
      A method for deducting the balance of the Actor's wallet. Although this can be handled by the Wallet class itself, the prevention of privacy leak is prioritised.
      Parameters:
      amount - the amount to be deducted from the balance

    • getBalance

      public int getBalance()
      A method for getting the balance of the Actor's wallet. Although this can be handled by the Wallet class itself, the prevention of privacy leak is prioritised.
      Returns:
      the balance of the Actor's wallet

    • updateDamageMultiplier

      public void updateDamageMultiplier​(float newDamageMultiplier)
      A method for updating the damage multiplier of the actor's intrinsic weapon. Although this can be implemented in the intrinsic weapon class itself, the prevention of privacy leak is prioritised.
      Parameters:
      newDamageMultiplier - the new damage multiplier.

    • increaseDamageMultiplier

      public void increaseDamageMultiplier​(float damageMultiplier)
      A method for increasing the damage multiplier of the actor's intrinsic weapon. Although this can be implemented in the intrinsic weapon class itself, the prevention of privacy leak is prioritised.
      Parameters:
      damageMultiplier - the damage multiplier to be added to the current damage multiplier.

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      A method for returning the string representation of an actor. It displays the actor's name and its current hit points, along with its maximum health hit points.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object

      Add an item to this Actor's inventory.
      Parameters:
      item - The Item to add.

    • removeItemFromInventory

      public void removeItemFromInventory​(Item item)
      Remove an item from this Actor's inventory. Although it is possible to return the itemInventory to be modified by the client directly, it is not done so to prevent privacy leak.
      Parameters:
      item - The Item to remove.

    • getItemInventory

      public java.util.List<Item> getItemInventory()
      Get a copy of this Actor's inventory list. Although it is possible to return the itemInventory to be modified by the client directly, it is not done so to prevent privacy leak.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable wrapper of the inventory.

    • playTurn

      public abstract Action playTurn​(ActionList actions, Action lastAction, GameMap map, Display display)
      Select and return an action to perform on the current turn.
      Parameters:
      actions - collection of possible Actions for this Actor
      lastAction - The Action this Actor took last turn. Can do interesting things in conjunction with Action.getNextAction()
      map - the map containing the Actor
      display - the I/O object to which messages may be written
      Returns:
      the Action to be performed

    • allowableActions

      public ActionList allowableActions​(Actor otherActor, java.lang.String direction, GameMap map)
      Returns a new collection of the Actions that the otherActor can do to the current Actor.
      Parameters:
      otherActor - the Actor that might be performing attack
      direction - String representing the direction of the other Actor
      map - current GameMap
      Returns:
      A collection of Actions.

    • isConscious

      public boolean isConscious()
      Is this Actor conscious? Returns true if the current Actor has positive hit points. Actors on zero hit points are deemed to be unconscious. Depending on the game client, this status may be interpreted as either unconsciousness or death, or inflict some other kind of status.
      Returns:
      true if and only if hitPoints is positive.

    • unconscious

      public java.lang.String unconscious​(Actor actor, GameMap map)
      Method that can be executed when the actor is unconscious due to the action of another actor
      Parameters:
      actor - the perpetrator
      map - where the actor fell unconscious
      Returns:
      a string describing what happened when the actor is unconscious

    • unconscious

      public java.lang.String unconscious​(GameMap map)
      Method that can be executed when the actor is unconscious due to natural causes or accident For example, the actor is unconscious due to them falling into a deep well.
      Parameters:
      map - where the actor fell unconscious
      Returns:
      a string describing what happened when the actor is unconscious

    • hurt

      public void hurt​(int damage)
      Hurt the current actor with the given damage points.
      Parameters:
      damage - the damage points that the actor receives

    • heal

      public void heal​(int points)
      Heal the current actor with the given health points.
      Parameters:
      points - the health points that the actor receives

    • getIntrinsicWeapon

      public IntrinsicWeapon getIntrinsicWeapon()
      Creates and returns an intrinsic weapon. Override this method to create an intrinsic weapon for the current Actor with more interesting descriptions and/or different damage.
      Returns:
      a freshly-instantiated IntrinsicWeapon

    • hasCapability

      public final boolean hasCapability​(java.lang.Enum<?> capability)
      Returns true if and only if the current Actor has the required capability. It will also return true if any of the items that the actor is carrying has the required capability.
      Overrides:
      hasCapability in class GameEntity
      Parameters:
      capability - the capability required
      Returns:
      true if and only if the current Actor has the required capability
